result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Lab Report

Filed by Atty. James

**Reviewed by Judge Bohren on October 14, 2022 - APPROVED.**
The original document was titled: Letter from Doctor
The original history event date is: 10-14-2022
Letter from Doctor

WCS Non Compliance Report dated October 10, 2022. Received and filed.

**Reviewed by Judge Bohren on October 11, 2022 - Court will review on 11/18/22.**
Hearing on November 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:25 AM Defendant Harlan H Stephens in court.  Attorney Thomas James in court for Harlan H Stephens.  Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin. City of New Berlin Police Department Officer Erin Godown sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Sitzberger. Cross examination by Attorney James. State rests. State moves for bind over without argument. Attorney James objects to bind over with argument. Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:07 AM Defendant Harlan H Stephens in court.  Attorney Thomas James in court for Harlan H Stephens.  Attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Campbell indicates the State received a call from their witness indicating she was ill so Attorney Campbell told her not to appear. Attorney James objects and moves for dismissal. The Court will allow for the adjournment over the objection. Time limits were previously waived. The Court addresses the WCS non-compliance letter filed on 09/15/2022. Attorney James makes statements regarding the WCS non-compliance. The State is quite concerned about the device tampers and would leave it to the Court. The Court will not take any action at this time but will order that with any further tampering of the SCRAM device or positive alcohol detection, WCS is to immediately notify the Court and a bench warrant will be issued for the defendant.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 21, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter dated 9/15 received and filed.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter dated 08-19-2022 received and filed.
Preliminary hearing on September 16, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Victim B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney, with the exception of third party contact for insurance purposes.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions. Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring and/or drug testing through WCS.  CAM duration and/or drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM and/or drug testing.  Defendant to report to WCS before the end of business today.

8:25 AM Defendant Harlan H Stephens in court.  Attorney Thomas James in court for Harlan H Stephens. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
